description: [Status: stable] [Name: str-or-repr-defined-in-stub] [Message: Defining {name} in a stub is almost always redundant] What it does Checks for redundant definitions of __str__ or __repr__ in stubs. Why is this bad? Defining __str__ or __repr__ in a stub is almost always redundant, as the signatures are almost always identical to those of the default equivalent, object.__str__ and object.__repr__, respectively. Example class Foo: def __repr__(self) -> str: ...
